description: Demolition of existing buildings and redevelopment of the site to provide a cafe/restaurant (Class A3) with an internal courtyard to link with a music/recital/practise hall (Sui Generis), and residential use (Class C3) to provide three 1-bed self-contained units.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The works hereby permitted shall be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this consent.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - The cafe/restaurant use hereby permitted shall not be carried out outside the following times 2300 to 0800 on Mondays to Saturdays and 2230 to 0800 on Sundays and Bank Holidays and no noise shall emanate from the premises within these times.  

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6 and R3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 3 - Noise levels at a point 1 metre external to sensitive facades shall be at least 5dB(A) less than the existing background measurement (LA90), expressed in dB(A) when all plant/equipment are in operation. Where it is anticipated that any plant/equipment will have a noise that has a distinguishable, discrete continuous note (whine, hiss, screech, hum) and/or if there are distinct impulses (bangs, clicks, clatters, thumps) special attention should be given to reducing the noise levels from that piece of plant/equipment at any sensitive fa�ade to at least 10dB(A) below the LA90, expressed in dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6, SD7B, SD8 and Appendix 1 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 4 - Detailed drawings, or samples of materials as appropriate, in respect of the following, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council before the relevant part of the work is begun:

a) Submission of section drawings through new openings including heads, jambs and cills at scale 1:5 including details of the new windows and doors to be inserted therein; 

b) Samples of all facing materials; 

c) Drawings at scale 1:10 of the first floor railings

d) Details (elevation and floorplan) of the new shopfront at ground floor level at scale 1:10 including details of materials

Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural and historic interest of the building in accordance with the requirements of policy B6 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 5 - For each of the octave band of centre frequencies 63Hz - 8KHz inclusive, noise levels from all plant/equipment (measured in LAeq) when in operation shall at all times add not more than 1 decibel to the existing background noise level LA90, expressed in dB(A), in the same octave band as measured 1 metre to external to sensitive facades.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6, SD7B, SD8 and Appendix 1 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 6 - The music recital hall use hereby permitted shall not be carried out during the following times 2300 to 0900 on Mondays to Saturdays and 2230 to 0900 on Sundays and Bank Holidays. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6 and C3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 7 - Details of a wall mounted lighting scheme and other security measures as necessary to Delancey Passage shall be submitted and approved before occupation of the building hereby approved.  Once approved, the lighting shall be permanently maintained and retained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the access to the residential units and to the music recital room is safe and secure and so that it incorporates adequate crime prevention measures in accordance with policy SD1 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Development Plan 2006.   
Condition : 8 - The French doors to the restaurant at first floor level hereby approved shall be permanently fixed shut and non-opening and maintained as such thereafter, or in accordance with a scheme submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6 and R3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 9 - Details showing the location of cycle storage for each of the residential flats hereby approved shall be submitted and approved prior to occupation of the flats.  

Reason:  To ensure that the proposal makes adequate provision for the storage of cycles in accordance with the requirements of policy T3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Development Plan 2006.  
Condition : 10 - Details showing the location of refuse storage for each of the residential flats hereby approved shall be submitted and approved prior to occupation of the flats.  

Reason:  To ensure that the proposal makes adequate provision for the storage of refuse in accordance with the requirements of policy SD6 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Development Plan 2006.    
Condition : 11 - Prior to the commencement of works on site, details of security measures to be installed on the Delancey Passage elevation shall be submitted and approved and thereafter maintained as such.  Such details shall consist of open mesh grille shutters and details of the specifications of the doors and glazing.  

Reason:  To ensure that the access to the residential units and to the music recital room is safe and secure and so that it incorporates adequate crime prevention measures in accordance with policy SD1 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Development Plan 2006.   
Condition : 12 - Details showing the location of refuse storage for cafe/restaurant use and the music recital hall hereby approved shall be submitted and approved prior to occupation of the flats.  

Reason:  To ensure that the proposal makes adequate provision for the storage of refuse in accordance with the requirements of policies R3, SD6 and C3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Development Plan 2006.    
Condition : 13 - Before the use commences, the extract ventilating system and air-condition plant shall be provided with acoustic isolation and sound attenuation in accordance with the scheme approved by the Council. The acoustic isolation shall thereafter be maintained in effective order to the reasonable satisfaction of the Council.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6 SD7B, SD8 and Appendix 1 and R3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 14 - The rooflights to the music recital hall hereby approved shall be fixed shut and non-openable, or in accordance with a scheme submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6 and C3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 15 - No mezzanine floor or additional floorspace shall be added to the music recital room hereby approved unless as agreed in writing as a varaition to this condition.  

Reason:  To ensure that the increase in customers/patrons at the premises can be assessed in terms of impact upon the transport network and impact on residential amenity in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6 and T9 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
